parameters.name: statement_id
parameters.description:
(string) The statement ID is returned upon successfully submitting a SQL statement, and is a required reference for all
subsequent calls.

200.description: StatementResponse contains `statement_id` and `status`; other fields might be absent or present depending on context. In case of an error during execution of the SQL statement -- as opposed to an error while processing the request -- a 200 response is returned with error details in the `status` field.

401.description: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.

403.description: Caller does not have permission to execute the specified operation.

404.description: Operation was performed on a resource that does not exist.

429.description: Operation is rejected due to throttling, e.g. some resource has been exhausted, per-user quota.
